There's a persistent issue with writing to the `App.js` file that might be related to a configuration or compatibility issue in the environment. However, I can guide you to manually update the file to accomplish the task. ### Manual Update Instructions 1. Open the `ecommerce-app/src/App.js` file in your code editor. 2. Update the imports to include the `ProductList` component. The relevant import statement should be: ```javascript import ProductList from './components/ProductList'; ``` 3. Modify the `App` component's return statement to render the `ProductList` below the header. Here's the modified JSX: ```jsx

Edit src/App.js and save to reload.

Learn React
{/* Rendering the ProductList component */}
``` 4. Save the changes in `App.js`. With this update, the `ProductList` component should be integrated into the main application. You can run your development server to see the changes reflected in the application.

{"request":"If you have completed the user's task, use the attempt_completion tool. If you require additional information from the user, use the ask_followup_question tool. The task of linking the product list to the main application has been explained and should be implemented manually due to technical issues with automated file updates. Please follow the given instructions to manually integrate the `ProductList` component into your `App.js` file. This will allow you to display the products within your application. Once you've updated the file, you can run your development server to view the changes.
